fields.description:
Having a frameable response can allow an attacker to load it within an iframe of an attacker's page and enable "clickjacking" attacks:

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Clickjacking

Setting X-FRAME-OPTIONS header mitigates this type of attacks and is supported by major browsers.
fields.summary: user console: add X-FRAME-OPTIONS header to all non-json proxy's responses

comments.body:
I'll extend Tornado's StaticFileHandler to add this header.

X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN

[~dkavanagh], please give me details on how to verify this.
Thank you, 
Alice

You can verify by using firebug (or chrome's javascript console) to inspect
the response headers. You should see "X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN"

[~dkavanagh], I checked Header of the DescribeAvailabilityZones call with Firebug, and I did not see X-Frame-Options. I included the screenshot. What am I missing?  

Thank you,
Alice
Although [~rusvika] didn't specify, I think this was only applied to static files being served. I wonder if we need to apply this to API call responses?
Verified option is present  in static file headers.

[~alice], thank you for verifying the fix. I put the bug back into the QA state and assigned to myself to remember to take another look at it when I'll be running a scanner as a part of my security review for 3.3.1.
[~dkavanagh], as discussed, assigning this bug back to you to try "DENY" instead of "SAMEORIGIN"
I've gone through a lot of screens/dialogs/help pages and not seen any ill effects from DENY. I'll test a little longer before pushing.
[~alice], after you do your testing please assign this bug to back to me.
Verified X-frame-options are set to DENY in both static  files and API call responses.
Response to "GET / " returns HTML but does not have X-FRAME-OPTIONS header.

I've tested using;
curl -v http://localhost:8888/ |head

and got;

* Connected to localhost (::1) port 8888 (#0)
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> User-Agent: curl/7.21.4 (universal-apple-darwin11.0) libcurl/7.21.4 OpenSSL/0.9.8x zlib/1.2.5
> Host: localhost:8888
> Accept: */*
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Content-Length: 59741
< Server: TornadoServer/2.4
< Etag: "aa2ed5221604e2de31edc1d3bb166f256eff2021"
< Pragma: no-cache
< Cache-control: no-cache
< X-Frame-Options: DENY
< Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
< 
{ [data not shown]
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
...
